step_description: enaknya apa
Prepare well-draining soil rich in organic matter. Add compost and mix thoroughly to a depth of 30 cm
Sow tomato seeds indoors 6-8 weeks before the last frost date. Transplant seedlings outdoors after the danger of frost has passed.
Water regularly to keep the soil moist but not waterlogged.  Use a balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks.  Remove suckers to encourage healthy growth and fruit production.
Harvest tomatoes when they are fully colored and slightly soft to the touch. Use a sharp knife or scissors to cut the fruit from the vine.
Ensure the soil is well-draining and slightly alkaline. Amend with sand or gravel if needed.
Sow lavender seeds indoors 8-10 weeks before the last frost. Transplant seedlings to a sunny spot with good air circulation.
Water sparingly as lavender prefers dry conditions.  Prune back in the spring to encourage bushy growth and more flowers.
Harvest lavender flowers just as the buds open. Cut stems early in the morning after the dew has dried.
Use well-draining soil with a neutral pH. Mix in compost to enrich the soil.
Direct sow basil seeds outdoors after the last frost or start seeds indoors 4 weeks before the last frost.
Keep the soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged.  Use a liquid fertilizer every 2-3 weeks.
Pinch off leaves as needed, starting from the top of the plant to encourage bushy growth.
Prepare well-draining soil rich in organic matter. Add compost and mix thoroughly to a depth of 20 cm.
Plant strawberry runners in early spring or late summer. Ensure roots are spread out and covered with soil.
Water regularly to keep soil evenly moist.  Use a balanced fertilizer high in phosphorus before flowering.  Mulch around plants to retain moisture and suppress weeds.
Harvest ripe strawberries by gently twisting them off the stem. Pick in the morning for the best flavor.
Use well-draining soil with sand or gravel for added drainage.
Plant rosemary cuttings in a sunny location with well-draining soil. Keep soil consistently moist until roots establish.
Water sparingly once established, allowing soil to dry out between waterings.  Prune lightly to maintain shape and promote new growth.
Harvest sprigs as needed throughout the year. Cut stems just above a leaf node.
Choose well-draining soil with added compost for fertility.
Directly sow sunflower seeds outdoors after the last frost date. Plant seeds 1 inch deep and 6 inches apart.
Water deeply once a week, ensuring soil stays moist but not waterlogged.  Stake tall varieties to prevent wind damage.
Harvest sunflower heads when petals wilt and seeds begin to develop. Cut stems with sharp pruners or scissors.
Plant peppermint in well-draining soil amended with compost to improve fertility.
Plant peppermint cuttings or small plants in a sunny to partially shaded location. Ensure roots are covered with soil.
Keep soil consistently moist, especially during hot weather.  Apply a balanced fertilizer once a month during the growing season.  Mulch around plants to retain moisture and suppress weeds.
Harvest peppermint leaves throughout the growing season by cutting stems just above a leaf node.
Use well-draining soil rich in organic matter. Incorporate compost and bone meal for nutrients.
Plant rose cuttings in prepared soil. Ensure the node is below soil level for rooting.
Water deeply to saturate the roots. Avoid overhead watering.Use a balanced rose fertilizer during the growing season.Prune in late winter to early spring for shape and remove dead wood.
Harvest roses as blooms open fully. Cut stems at a diagonal for longer vase life.
Use fertile soil with good drainage. Incorporate compost to improve soil fertility.
Directly sow cucumber seeds in a sunny location after the danger of frost has passed. Plant seeds 1 cm deep and space them 30 cm apart.
Water the plants regularly to maintain soil moisture.Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizer every 3-4 weeks during the growing season.Trim unnecessary branches to stimulate plant growth.
Harvest cucumbers when they reach the desired size by cutting the stem below the fruit.
Use well-draining soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.5. Incorporate organic matter like compost for nutrients.
Start geranium seeds indoors 10-12 weeks before the last frost date. Sow seeds in a seed-starting mix, lightly covering them with soil.

Water geraniums deeply once a week, allowing the soil to dry slightly between watering.Apply a balanced fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during the growing season to promote continuous flowering.Remove spent blooms regularly to encourage new flower production.
Harvest geranium blooms as needed by cutting the stems just above a pair of leaves. Use the harvested flowers in arrangements or as decorative accents.
Plant orchids in a well-draining orchid mix or bark chips to mimic their natural epiphytic growing conditions.
Start orchid seeds in a sterile, well-draining seed-starting mix. Maintain high humidity and consistent warmth to encourage germination.

Water orchids thoroughly once a week, allowing excess water to drain completely.Maintain high humidity levels around orchids through regular misting or a humidity tray.Use a balanced orchid fertilizer monthly during active growth phases to support flowering.
Harvest orchid blooms by cutting the flower stems close to the base. Use the blooms for decorative purposes.
Plant lemon trees in well-draining soil enriched with organic matter. Ensure soil pH is slightly acidic to neutral.
Start lemon trees from seeds indoors or directly in the ground. Plant seeds 1 inch deep in moist soil and keep them warm until germination.

Water deeply but infrequently, allowing the top 2 inches of soil to dry out between waterings.Apply a balanced citrus fertilizer every 6-8 weeks during the growing season to promote healthy growth and fruit production.Prune lemon trees in late winter to early spring to remove dead or diseased branches and promote air circulation.
Harvest lemons when they are fully yellow and firm. Cut or twist fruits from the tree carefully to avoid damaging the branches.
Plant mango trees in well-draining soil enriched with organic matter. Ensure soil pH is slightly acidic to neutral.
Choose a sunny location with protection from strong winds. Dig a hole twice as wide as the root ball and plant at the same level as in the nursery pot.

Water deeply but infrequently, allowing the top 2 inches of soil to dry out between waterings.Apply a balanced fertilizer formulated for fruit trees every 6-8 weeks during the growing season to promote healthy growth and fruit production.Prune mango trees in late winter to early spring to remove dead or diseased branches and promote air circulation.
Harvest mangoes when they are fully ripe and have developed their characteristic color and aroma. Use a pole picker or hand pick them carefully to avoid damaging the fruit or tree.
Plant Aloe Vera in well-draining sandy or cactus mix soil to prevent waterlogging.
Start Aloe Vera from seeds indoors or directly in the ground. Plant seeds 1/4 inch deep in a well-draining soil mix.

Water Aloe Vera deeply but infrequently, allowing the soil to dry out completely between waterings.Use a diluted succulent fertilizer monthly during the growing season to support healthy leaf growth.Repot Aloe Vera every 2-3 years to refresh the soil and accommodate new growth.
Harvest mature leaves as needed by cutting them close to the base of the plant. Use a sharp knife to avoid damaging the plant.
biarkan tumbuh secara alami
Biarkan terkena matahari sepanjang hari dan berikan air secukupnya
Use fertile soil with good drainage. Incorporate compost to improve soil fertility.
How to care for Alang-Alang
